div.h1: The WSO2 Complex Event Processing Server (CEP) @product.version@ Released!
div.p: The WSO2 CEP team is pleased to announce the release of version @product.version@ of the Open Source Complex Event Processing Server (CEP).

WSO2 Complex Event Processing Server (WSO2 CEP) is to be your Complex Event Processing System. Our ultimate goal is to provide you with the suitable capability of defining , filtering and triggering events according to your organization's decisions
CEP 1.0.0 supports analyzing input events and triggering new events according to the rules defined by your organization.

WSO2 CEP @product.version@ is developed on top of the revolutionary Carbon platform , and is based on the OSGi framework to achieve the better modularity for your Service Oriented Architecture (SOA). This also contains a lots of new features and many other optional components to customize the behavior of the server. Further, if you do not want any of the built in features, you can uninstall those features without any trouble. In other words, CEP can be customized to your SOA needs.

ol.li: Go to the bin directory in the extracted folder
Run the wso2server.sh or wso2server.bat as appropriate
Point your browser to the URL https://localhost:9443/carbon
Use "admin", "admin" as the username and password to login as an admin and create a user account
Assign the required permissions to the user through a role

If you need to start the OSGi console with the server use the property -DosgiConsole when starting the server. The INSTALL.txt file found on the installation directory will give you a comprehensive set of options and properties that can be passed into the startup script

ul.li: Bring CEP to SOA by processing XML events and produce results as XML events
Ability to define different event streams, queries and out put streams and store them in the registry as a bucket
Support EsperTM and fusion back end runtimes
Ability to filter data from the XML event using xpath and format the result as an XML event
Support different types of brokers WS-Event, JMS to receive publish events
Define and store such different broker configurations
Administrative Console to create bucks, add subscriptions etc..
Ability to specify CEP queries inline or pick from the registry
